alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Kanawha; Mason; Putnam (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 7:01PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms and heavy rain will impact portions of central Mason, northwestern Kanawha, Putnam and southwestern Jackson Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 700 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms from near Poca to near Teays Valley. Movement was north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Nitro, Ripley, Winfield, Hurricane, Sissonville, Eleanor, Buffalo, Poca, Cross Lanes, Teays Valley, Bancroft, Leon, Given, Southside, Liberty, Grimms Landing, Evans, Fraziers Bottom, Fairplain and Gallopolis Ferry. This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 110 and 113, and between mile markers 133 and 138. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 34 and 46. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
